FuncDef:
The ptp alarm-threshold clock-class command configures an alarm threshold for time source input deterioration.
The undo ptp alarm-threshold clock-class command restores the default configuration.
By default, the alarm threshold for time source input deterioration is 6.

ParaDef.Info:
Displays the alarm threshold of time source input deterioration.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 255.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Packet bearer devices can input reference clock signals through a PTP or 1PPS+TOD interface for time synchronization. When a PTP interface is used to input reference clock signals, the clockClass of the clock source is less than the alarm generation threshold configured using the ptp alarm-threshold clock-class command, and the stepsRemoved of the clock source is 0, an alarm is generated, indicating that the input reference clock signals deteriorate. When a 1PPS+TOD interface is used to input reference clock signals and the clockClass of the clock source is less than the alarm generation threshold configured using the ptp alarm-threshold clock-class command, an alarm is generated, indicating that the input reference clock signals deteriorate.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
